pr_title: Add some new MP Compatibility tests

timeline.bodyText: I am wondering whether a better fix is to add the jaeger client jar and add the classloader element in the server.xml so that this warning message will not appear any more.
timeline.author: Emily-Jiang

replies.bodyText: I think a better fix is to not output the message at all. I haven't configured a jaeger server so why would I need a jaeger client?
replies.author: tevans78

replies.bodyText: I think the warning is about the partial open tracing client set up. With the client, the app will be able to correlate the trace span. It does not matter whether there is a server or not. It is like you have all info no matter you want to look at them or not. The client should not rely on server at all.
replies.author: Emily-Jiang

timeline.bodyText: Context Propagation won't be released when MP 4.0 is out. Will this cause any issue?
timeline.author: Emily-Jiang

replies.bodyText: No, these tests even run against no-ship features
replies.author: tevans78

timeline.author: Emily-Jiang

replies.bodyText: um, that might have been Eclipse being special?!
replies.author: tevans78

timeline.bodyText: Do we still need this one? Which tests use it?
timeline.author: Emily-Jiang

replies.bodyText: ConfiguredJAXRSCDITest and BasicJAXRSCDITest use this server
replies.author: tevans78

timeline.bodyText: Might be that this server.xml isn't used any more?
timeline.author: tevans78

timeline.bodyText: Should you enable this test but add the server error ignore and then add a comment to that issue? When the issue is fixed, the warning can be removed.
timeline.author: Emily-Jiang

timeline.message: Consolidate MicroProfile FAT tests into one project and add some MP Compatible tests
Refactor IndexInitializer to ensure FFDC is not output from IOException
Refactor IndexInitializer to ensure FFDC is not output from IOException
Refactor IndexInitializer to ensure FFDC is not output from IOException

timeline.bodyText: I think we still want the @FFDCIgnore(IOException.class) here so that FFDC is not logged here too.  Otherwise, I think these changes look good.
timeline.author: andymc12

replies.bodyText: I disagree, that is a different IOException to the one which we were originally intending to ignore. That IOException comes from the initial setup of the InputStream. The one we were intending to ignore before was from the reader.read() method.
replies.author: tevans78

replies.bodyText: Slight correction; the IOException comes from the automatic call to InputStream.close() ... if that goes wrong, we want to know about it.
replies.author: tevans78
